description: ENISA Nefarious Activity or Abuse (ENAA) - Nafarious or Abusive activity on or around IT assets.

values.description: Test place holder
Threat of receive of unsolicited E-mail that affect for information security and efficienty of work. SPAM or Unsolicited infected E-mail.

Threat of Deny of service type attacks at information systems or services. Distributed Denial of network service (DDoS) (network layer attack i.e. Protocol exploitation, Malformed packets, Flooding, Spoofing et al.). Distributed Denial of application service (DDoS) (application layer attack i.e. Ping of Death, XDoS, WinNuke, HTTP Floods et al.). Distributed DoS (DDoS) to both network and application services (amplification, reflection methods i.e NTP, DNS, BitTorrent et al.)
values.value: ENAA 3 - Denial of Service (DoS) or Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS)

values.description: Threat of malicious code or software execution or abuse of resources. Additionally - Search Engine Poisoning, Exploitation of fake trust of Social Media, Worms, Trojans, Rootkits, Mobile malware, Infected Trusted Mobile Apps, Elevation of privileges, Web Application attacks, Injection attacks (Code injection, SQL, XSS), Spyware, Deceptive Adware, Viruses, Rogue security software, Rogueware, Scareware, Ransomware, Exploits, and Exploit Kits.
values.value: ENAA 4 - Malicious Code, Software, or Activity

values.description: Threat of manipulation from false text or audio. Masqurading or pretexting. Phishing attacks or Spear Phishing attacks.
Leakage affecting mobile privacy and mobile applications. Leakage affecting web privacy and web applications. Leakage affecting network traffic. Leakage affecting cloud computing.

Threat of use of rogue certificates. Loss of (integrity of) sensitive information. Man in the middle or Session hijacking. Social Engineering or Signed Malware (e.g. install fake trust OS updates â€“ signed malware). Fake SSL certificates.
values.value: ENAA 7 - Generation and Use of Rogue Certificates

values.description: Threat of unauthorized manipulation of hardware and software. Anonymous proxies. Abuse of computing power of cloud to launch attacks (cybercrime as a service). Abuse of vulnerabilities, 0-day vulnerabilities. Access of web sites through chains of HTTP Proxies (Obfuscation). Access to device software. Alternation of software. Rogue hardware.
values.value: ENAA 8 - Manipulation of Hardware and Software

values.description: Threat of intentional data manipulation to mislead information systems or somebody or to cover other nefarious activities (loss of integrity of information). Repudiation of actions. Address Space hijacking (IP prefixes). Routing table manipulation. DNS poisoning, DNS spoofing, or DNS Manipulations. Falsification of record. Address Space hijacking or Address Space manipulation. Falsification of configurations.
Threat of nefarious actions with use of audit tools (discovery security weaknesses in information systems).

Unauthorized use or administration of devices and systems. Unauthorized use of software. Unauthorized access to the information systems or networks (IMPI Protocol, DNS Register Hijacking et al.). Network Intrusion. Unauthorized changes of records.
Threat of unauthorized installation of software. Web based attacks (Drive-by download, malicious URLs, Browser based attacks).
Threat of data breach.
values.value: ENAA 13 - Compromising Confidential Information or Data Breaches

values.description: Threat of disruption of work due to False rumor or a fake warning.
Threat of remote activity over controled IT Assets. Remote Command Execution. Remote Access Tool (RAT). Botnets or Remote activity.
Threat of sophisticated targetes attack with combination of many attack techniques. Mobile malware. Spear phishing attacks. Installation of sophisticated and targeted malware. Watering Hole attacks.
values.value: ENAA 16 - Targeted Attacks or APT Like Activity

values.description: Process of the buisiness that has failed.
Repeated attempts to compromise an asset or system.
Abusing given privileges on an asset or system.
Threat of identity theft action. Credentials stealing trojans.
values.value: ENAA 1 - Identity Theft, Fraud, or Account Abuse
